metadata.title: Best Documentary YouTube Tools 2025: Doc Filmmaker Equipment Guide
metadata.description: Top tools for documentary YouTube channels. Cinematic equipment for doc creators.

hero.headline: Best Documentary YouTube Tools 2025
hero.subheadline: Tell important stories cinematically. Equipment for doc creators.

sections.content: Documentary filmmaking on YouTube ranges from investigative journalism to personal essays. The format demands professional audio, B-roll flexibility, and often remote or challenging shooting conditions. Here's what documentary creators need.

content.title: Sony A7 Series
content.description: Full-frame, great low light. Documentary workhorse.

content.title: iPhone 15 Pro
content.description: Surprisingly capable. Log profile available. Ultimate portability.

content.title: Shotgun Microphone
content.description: Rode NTG series, Sennheiser. Essential for interviews.

content.title: Wireless Lavs
content.description: Rode Wireless Go, Deity. Backup audio always.

content.title: Field Recorder
content.description: Zoom F6 or similar. Professional audio capture.

content.title: Portable Lighting
content.description: LED panels, Aputure. Control light in any location.

content.title: Travel Tripod
content.description: Sturdy but portable. Peak Design, Manfrotto.

content.title: Power Solutions
content.description: Extra batteries, portable chargers. Field requires redundancy.

faq.question: Can I make documentaries with a phone?
faq.answer: Yesâ€”Tangerine was shot on iPhone. Modern phones are capable. Audio is where you need to invest. External mic essential.

faq.question: Most important equipment?
faq.answer: Audio equipment. Bad audio ruins documentaries. Camera can be basic if audio is professional. Invest in mics and recording.

faq.question: How to get good interviews?
faq.answer: Proper lighting, good audio, comfortable subject. Position camera at eye level. Create safe space. Listen more than direct.

faq.question: What about releases and rights?
faq.answer: Get signed releases from subjects. Clear music and archival footage. Fair use for commentary but not guaranteed. Consult lawyer for sensitive topics.
